title: 'A mouse ate my tax receipts': deadline looms for lodging returns
text:
As many as 300,000 taxpayers could be missing out on cash from the Tax Office, two weeks before the deadline to lodge annual returns.

The ATO's Karen Foat says it's becoming increasingly quick and painless to lodge tax returns. ATO

ATO assistant commissioner Karen Foat said that last year about 475,000 Australians had filed their annual tax returns late and more than 300,000 people were delayed a refund cheque as a result.

The deadline for lodging a return or engaging a tax agent is October 31.

“We know that tax can seem complicated, which is why we see so many people putting it off," Ms Foat said.

"People should know that it’s actually becoming increasingly quick and painless to lodge your return.
description: In 2018, about 475,000 Australians completed their annual tax return late, potentially delaying a refund cheque from the ATO.
